# 2008 Arizona Republican presidential primary

| image_size = 150x150px

| home_state1 = Arizona
| delegate_count1 = 50

| percentage1 = 47.17%

| home_state2 = Massachusetts
| delegate_count2 = 0

| color3 = 990000
| candidate3 = Mike Huckabee

| map_image = Arizona Republican Presidential Primary Election Results by County, 2008.svg
| map_size = 250x250px

| outgoing_members = AK
| elected_members = AR
| votes_for_election = 53 delegates to the Republican National Convention(50 pledged, 3 unpledged)
}}
The 2008 Arizona Republican presidential primary took place on February 5, 2008, with 50 national delegates. John McCain would be able to win his homestate against competitors Mitt Romney and Mike Huckabee.
Results
}}
Note: * Includes 3 unpledged Republican National Committee delegates
